result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:08 AM Defendant Tyler William Brumfield appeared in custody by video with Atty Winder in court for Attorney Paisley S Hoffman.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DE Brumfield is not feeling well and appears from the GC jail by video.  Atty Winder addresses her client as to personal appearance.  DE Brumfield wishes to appear in person.   WTLPH again waived today.  Rescheduled PH for 22cf38.  Bail is addressed for both 22-cf-38 & 22-CF-43. ADA Lantta asks that original bail be set.  Court is interrupted by DE.  Atty Winder asks her client to remain silent.  ADA Lantta responds to the court's inquiry and again addresses the bail request.  Atty Winder does indicate her client has an atty representing him in IL and also addresses bail.  Court cites 966.08.  ADA Lantta addresses the court.  Atty Winder addresses the court.  Court denies Atty Winder's request and amends the bonds as originally stated and set.  Court warns DE Brumfield as to verbally interrupting these proceedings.  Court mutes the jail for interrupting.  PH set for 22cf38.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
